title: Mahama's promise of 123 SHS by 2016 is a myth - Baako
text:
Politics | 21 October 2015 18:36 CET Mahama's promise of 123 SHS by 2016 is a myth - Baako Source: Adomonline.com 
Managing Editor of the New Crusading Guide Newspaper, Abdul Malik Kweku Baako has described as a ‘myth’ claims by the President that his government would deliver hundred and twenty three (123) free-day Senior High School (SHS) infrstructure by the close of next year. 
His claim, he said, stems from the fact that the government is facing ‘serious budget constraints’ which has made financing the school projects very difficult. 
“The 123 SHS is a myth, it is not happening, they can’t deliver the so-called 123 schools…it’s a myth…,” he said. 
President John Dramani Mahama addressing an NDC rally in Koforidua on Saturday, 17 th October, 2015 said that his government is on course to delivering about 123 out of the promised 200 in the budget by next year. 
The President told NDC supporters gathered at the Jackson Park that the 123 free-day SHSs would be delivered to provide about 240,000 vacancies for students seeking entry into Senior High Schools. 
The promise was made on the back of his commissioning of two of the free SHSs in Otuam in the Central Region and Bemeanko in the Western Region. 
But the veteran journalists speaking on Accra-based Peace FM challenged the President and NDC communicators to be truthful to Ghanaians on the promise as ‘it can’t be realized before next year’s elections.’ 
He further explained that the New Patriotic Party (NPP) flagbearer, Nana Addo during the 2012 electioneering campaign also promised a progressive free SHS policy.
